question1.label: Or Zarua
question1.tooltip: Or Zarua is a chumra where you seperate another onah before each of the seperation days

question2.label: Average cycle occurs on
question2.tooltip: Choose “30th day only”, or “30th & 31st day”, based on your customs. (Onah Beinonis)

question3.label: Monthly Cycle
question3.tooltip: Choose either “Never carried beyond one month (Shaarei Tohar)” or “Monthly Cycle observed the next month if not passed in purity (Igros Moshe)” based on your Psak. These options guide how you observe Yom Hachodesh each month.

options.never_carried: Monthly cycle never carried beyond one month
options.never_carriedTooltip: According to Family Purity & Times by Rabbi F. Jacobs, and Tahara Kehalocho by Rabbi Y. Farkash
options.observed_next_month: Monthly cycle observed the next month if not passed in purity
options.observed_next_monthTooltip: Monthly cycle observed the next month if not passed in purity

question4.label: Length of average cycle
question4.tooltip: Do you keep Onah Beinonis for the full day on which it falls, or only for half a day based on when you got your flow on the previous cycle?

question5.label: Monthly cycle for 30th day in 29 day month
question5.tooltip: Choose how you observe Yom Hachodesh if it falls on the 30th day of a month with 29 days

question6.label: Shorter interval uproots longer
question6.tooltip: Choose No or Yes based on your Psak. This relates to whether or not you observe a chumra (Haflagah Gedolah) or the regular haflagah when tracking intervals

question7.label: Monthly Cycle
question7.tooltip: Choose either “Never carried beyond one month (Shaarei Tohar)” or “Monthly Cycle observed the next month if not passed in purity (Igros Moshe)” based on your Psak. These options guide how you observe Yom Hachodesh each month.

options.never_carried: Monthly cycle never carried beyond one month
options.never_carried_tooltip: If you select “Never carried beyond one month,” you will observe only the most recent Yom Hachodesh, which is calculated from the previous month. This means you do not carry forward any dates beyond one month.
options.observed_next_month: Monthly cycle observed the next month if not passed in purity
options.observed_next_monthTooltip: If you select “Monthly Cycle observed the next month if not passed in purity,” you will observe two Yom Hachodesh dates the following month if you get your period before the expected date. This includes both the earlier and later dates if your period hasn’t occurred by then.

question8.label: Interval counting
question8.tooltip: Choose the “Ramban” option unless you follow Minhag Chabad.

options.ramban: Number of days from previous onset (Ramban)
options.ramban_tooltip: Number of days from previous onset (Ramban)
options.chabad: Number of half-days from previous hefsek (chabad)
options.chabad_tooltip: Number of half-days from previous hefsek (chabad)

1.question: What is Mikvah Tracker?
1.answer: Mikvah Tracker is an online, user-friendly tool to help guide women in keeping a family purity (Taharas Hamishpacha) calendar.

2.question: Is Mikvah Tracker confidential?
2.answer: Yes. All of your personal information is kept strictly private. Your data is password protected and is only visible to you.

3.question: What if I miss a month of tracking in my calendar?
3.answer: Dates can be recorded at a later time as long as the dates are all inputted in chronological order. It is strongly recommended to record dates on time to ensure important events are not missed.

4.question: Should I still keep a hard copy of my calendar?
4.answer: It is recommended to also record these calculations yourself on a hard copy for backup and reference purposes.

5.question: Is the estimated ovulation date accurate?
5.answer: Women typically ovulate around 14 days before the start of their next menstrual period. However, this can vary depending on the individual woman and her cycle. Most healthcare providers recommend utilizing a calendar along with other medical tests to determine a woman’s true ovulation date.

6.question: Does Mikvah Tracker calculate all patterns in my cycle?
6.answer: Mikvah Tracker calculates standard Vestos and Kavua patterns. Some women may experience unique or complex cycle patterns that may not be reflected in the app. If you feel that guidance on atypical patterns is needed, please consult with a rabbi who is knowledgeable in Family Purity laws.

7.question: Is my data safe & protected?
7.answer: All of your personal information is kept strictly private. Your data is password protected and is only visible to you.

1.question: How do I log a flow?
1.answer: To log a flow, navigate to the Calendar tab and select the start date of the flow. In the slide-up sheet, click ‘Log flow’. Enter in the location and time blood was found, then select the ‘Done’ button. The app calculates the rest!

2.question: How do I log a Hefsek Tahara?
2.answer: To log a Hefsek Tahara, navigate to the Calendar tab and select the ‘Log HT’ button on the top right corner. Enter the location and time of HT, then select the ‘Done’ button.

3.question: How do I edit/delete a flow?
3.answer: On the calendar tab, select the first day of the most recent flow that you’d like to delete. In the ‘Logs’ section, select the edit button to edit, select the delete button to delete.

4.question: How do I edit/delete a Hefsek Tahara?
4.answer: On the calendar tab, select the Hefsek Tahara date that you’d like to delete. In the ‘Logs’ section, select the edit button to edit, select the delete button to delete.

5.question: How do I add a note?
5.answer: On the calendar tab, select the date that you want to log a note for. In the slide-up sheet, enter your comment in the ‘Note’ section and select ‘Done’.

6.question: How do I change my notification settings?
6.answer: On the Profile tab, select Reminders, change your preferences and click ‘Save’.

7.question: How do I change my rabbinical preferences?
7.answer: On the Profile tab, select Rabbinical Preferences, change your preferences and click ‘Save’.

8.question: How do I change my location settings?
8.answer: On the Profile tab, select Location, change your preferences and click ‘Save’.

9.question: How do I change my language settings?
9.answer: On the Profile tab, select your profile at the top, change your language preferences and click ‘Save’.

1.question: How do I edit the start date of my Flow?
1.answer: To edit the start date of your Flow, go to the calendar view and click on the date you want to edit. You can then edit the date and time of your Flow.

2.question: What is Mikvah Tracker?
2.answer: Mikvah Tracker is an online, user-friendly tool to help guide women in keeping a family purity (Taharas Hamishpacha) calendar.

3.question: Is Mikvah Tracker confidential?
3.answer: Yes. All of your personal information is kept strictly private. Your data is password protected and is only visible to you.

4.question: What if I miss a month of tracking in my calendar?
4.answer: Dates can be recorded at a later time as long as the dates are all inputted in chronological order. It is strongly recommended to record dates on time to ensure important events are not missed.

5.question: I accidentally entered an incorrect date or time, how do I change it?
5.answer: On the calendar tab, select the first day of the most recent flow or hefsek that you’d like to delete. To edit, select the edit button. To delete, select the delete button.

6.question: Should I still keep a hard copy of my calendar?
6.answer: It is recommended to also record these calculations yourself on a hard copy for backup and reference purposes.

7.question: Is the estimated ovulation date accurate?
7.answer: Women typically ovulate around 14 days before the start of their next menstrual period. However, this can vary depending on the individual woman and her cycle. Most healthcare providers recommend utilizing a calendar along with other medical tests to determine a woman’s true ovulation date.

8.question: Does Mikvah Tracker calculate all patterns in my cycle?
8.answer: Mikvah Tracker calculates standard Vestos and Kavua patterns. Some women may experience unique or complex cycle patterns that may not be reflected in the app. If you feel that guidance on atypical patterns is needed, please consult with a rabbi who is knowledgeable in Family Purity laws.

1.title: WHAT INFORMATION DO WE COLLECT?
1.content_01: We collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when registering in the Mikvah Tracker app, such as your name, email, and any data you enter into the app.

2.title: HOW DO WE PROCESS YOUR INFORMATION?
2.content_01: We process your information to provide, improve, and personalize our services. The data collected is used solely for app calculations and enhancing user experience. We do not share your data with third parties.

3.title: WHAT LEGAL BASES DO WE RELY ON TO PROCESS YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?
3.content_01: We process your personal information for legitimate business interests, the performance of our contract with you, compliance with our legal obligations, and/or your consent.

4.title: WHEN AND WITH WHOM DO WE SHARE YOUR PERSONAL INFORMATION?
4.content_01: We do not share your personal information with third parties unless it is necessary to comply with legal obligations or to protect your rights.

5.title: DO WE USE COOKIES AND OTHER TRACKING TECHNOLOGIES?
5.content_01: Yes, we use cookies to collect data on user behavior to improve our app and user experience. The information collected is used for analytics and personalization.

6.title: HOW DO WE HANDLE YOUR SOCIAL LOGINS?
6.content_01: If you choose to register or log in using a social media account, we may have access to certain information such as your name, profile picture, and email address. This data is used to facilitate your login and enhance your user experience.

7.title: IS YOUR INFORMATION TRANSFERRED INTERNATIONALLY?
7.content_01: Our servers are located in the United States. If you are accessing our app from outside the United States, please be aware that your information may be transferred to, stored, and processed by us in our facilities and by those third parties with whom we may share your personal information.

8.title: HOW LONG DO WE KEEP YOUR INFORMATION?
8.content_01: We keep your information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy policy unless otherwise required by law.

9.title: HOW DO WE KEEP YOUR INFORMATION SAFE?
9.content_01: We have implemented appropriate technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process. However, please remember that we cannot guarantee that the internet itself is 100% secure.

10.title: DO WE COLLECT INFORMATION FROM MINORS?
10.content_01: We do not knowingly collect data from or market to children under 18 years of age. If we learn that we have collected personal information from a child under age 18, we will delete that information as quickly as possible.

11.title: WHAT ARE YOUR PRIVACY RIGHTS?
11.content_01: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, including the right to access, correct, or delete your data.

12.title: CONTROLS FOR DO-NOT-TRACK FEATURES
12.content_01: Most web browsers and some mobile operating systems and applications include a Do-Not-Track (“DNT”) feature or setting you can activate to signal your privacy preference not to have data about your online browsing activities monitored and collected.

13.title: DO UNITED STATES RESIDENTS HAVE SPECIFIC PRIVACY RIGHTS?
13.content_01: Yes, if you are a resident of California or another state with privacy laws, you may have additional rights regarding your personal information.

14.title: DO WE MAKE UPDATES TO THIS NOTICE?
14.content_01: Yes, we may update this privacy notice from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by updating the 'Last updated' date of this notice. We encourage you to review this privacy notice frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.

15.title: HOW CAN YOU CONTACT US ABOUT THIS NOTICE?
15.content_01: If you have questions or comments about this notice, you may contact us by email at info@mikvahtracker.com or by mail at: EWS Automation, 123 Main Street, Baltimore, MD 21201, United States.

16.title: HOW CAN YOU REVIEW, UPDATE, OR DELETE THE DATA WE COLLECT FROM YOU?
16.content_01: You have the right to request access to the personal information we collect from you, change that information, or delete it. To request to review, update, or delete your personal information, please submit a request to info@mikvahtracker.com. We will respond within 30 days.

1.title: Our Services
1.content_01: Mikvah Tracker is designed to assist with calculating your onot (days) of separation, but it is essential to perform these calculations independently as well. The online calendar serves as a learning tool and a means of double-checking your results. Please note that some halachic authorities hold that the obligation to record onot cannot be fulfilled solely through computerized means.
1.content_02: Additionally, if you observe specific stringencies (chumrahs) or use alternative calculation methods with the explicit guidance of your rabbi, you will need to manually enter those dates of separation into your online calendar using the Note system.
1.content_03: The information provided when using the Services is not intended for distribution to or use by any person or entity in any jurisdiction or country where such distribution or use would be contrary to law or regulation or which would subject us to any registration requirement within such jurisdiction or country. Accordingly, those persons who choose to access the Services from other locations do so on their own initiative and are solely responsible for compliance with local laws, if and to the extent local laws are applicable.

2.title: Entire Agreement
2.content_01: We are Mikvah Tracker ("Company," "we," "us," "our"). We operate, as well as any other related products and services that refer or link to these legal terms (the "Legal Terms") (collectively, the "Services"). You can contact us by email at info@mikvahtracker.com.
2.content_02: These Legal Terms constitute a legally binding agreement made between you, whether personally or on behalf of an entity ("you"), and Mikvah Tracker, concerning your access to and use of the Services. You agree that by accessing the Services, you have read, understood, and agreed to be bound by all of these Legal Terms. If you do not agree with all of these legal terms, then you are expressly prohibited from using the services and you must discontinue use immediately.
2.content_03: Supplemental terms and conditions or documents that may be posted on the Services from time to time are hereby expressly incorporated herein by reference. We reserve the right, in our sole discretion, to make changes or modifications to these Legal Terms at any time and for any reason. We will alert you about any changes by updating the "Last updated" date of these Legal Terms, and you waive any right to receive specific notice of each such change. It is your responsibility to periodically review these Legal Terms to stay informed of updates. You will be subject to, and will be deemed to have been made aware of and to have accepted, the changes in any revised Legal Terms by your continued use of the Services after the date such revised Legal Terms are posted. We recommend that you print a copy of these Legal Terms for your records.

You agree that we shall own this Submission and be entitled to its unrestricted use and dissemination for any lawful purpose, commercial or otherwise, without acknowledgment or compensation to you.

4.content_01: By using the Services, you represent and warrant that: (1) you have the legal capacity and you agree to comply with these Legal Terms; (2) you are not a minor in the jurisdiction in which you reside; (3) you will not access the Services through automated or non-human means, whether through a bot, script or otherwise; (4) you will not use the Services for any illegal or unauthorized purpose; and (5) your use of the Services will not violate any applicable law or regulation.

11.title: Governing Law
11.content_01: These Legal Terms shall be governed by and defined following the laws of the United States. Mikvah Tracker and yourself irrevocably consent that the courts of Baltimore shall have exclusive jurisdiction to resolve any dispute which may arise in connection with these Legal Terms.

12.title: Dispute Resolution
12.content_01: Informal Negotiations: To expedite resolution and control the cost of any dispute, controversy, or claim related to these Legal Terms (each a 'Dispute' and collectively, the 'Disputes') brought by either you or us (individually, a 'Party' and collectively, the 'Parties'), the Parties agree to first attempt to negotiate any Dispute (except those Disputes expressly provided below) informally for at least 180 days before initiating arbitration. Such informal negotiations commence upon written notice from one Party to the other Party.
12.content_02: Binding Arbitration: Any dispute arising out of or in connection with these Legal Terms, including any question regarding its existence, validity, or termination, shall be referred to and finally resolved by the International Commercial Arbitration Court under the European Arbitration Chamber (Belgium, Brussels, Avenue Louise, 146) according to the Rules of this ICAC, which, as a result of referring to it, is considered as part of this clause. The number of arbitrators shall be two. The seat, or legal place, of arbitration shall be Baltimore. The language of the proceedings shall be English. The governing law of these Legal Terms shall be substantive law of the United States.
12.content_03: Restrictions: The Parties agree that any arbitration shall be limited to the Dispute between the Parties individually. To the full extent permitted by law, (a) no arbitration shall be joined with any other proceeding; (b) there is no right or authority for any Dispute to be arbitrated on a class-action basis or to utilize class action procedures; and (c) there is no right or authority for any Dispute to be brought in a purported representative capacity on behalf of the general public or any other persons.
12.content_04: Exceptions to Informal Negotiations and Arbitration: The Parties agree that the following Disputes are not subject to the above provisions concerning informal negotiations binding arbitration: (a) any Disputes seeking to enforce or protect, or concerning the validity of, any of the intellectual property rights of a Party; (b) any Dispute related to, or arising from, allegations of theft, piracy, invasion of privacy, or unauthorized use; and (c) any claim for injunctive relief. If this provision is found to be illegal or unenforceable, then neither Party will elect to arbitrate any Dispute falling within that portion of this provision found to be illegal or unenforceable and such Dispute shall be decided by a court of competent jurisdiction within the courts listed for jurisdiction above, and the Parties agree to submit to the personal jurisdiction of that court.

13.title: Corrections
13.content: There may be information on the Services that contains typographical errors, inaccuracies, or omissions, including descriptions, pricing, availability, and various other information. We reserve the right to correct any errors, inaccuracies, or omissions and to change or update the information on the Services at any time, without prior notice.

14.title: Disclaimer
14.content:
Mikvah Tracker is designed to assist with calculating your onot (days) of separation, but it is essential to perform these calculations independently as well. The online calendar serves as a learning tool and a means of double-checking your results. Please note that some halachic authorities hold that the obligation to record onot cannot be fulfilled solely through computerized means.

Additionally, if you observe specific stringencies (chumrahs) or use alternative calculation methods with the explicit guidance of your rabbi, you will need to manually enter those dates of separation into your online calendar using the Note system.

The services are provided on an as-is and as-available basis. You agree that your use of the services will be at your sole risk. To the fullest extent permitted by law, we disclaim all warranties, express or implied, in connection with the services and your use thereof, including, without limitation, the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, and non-infringement. We make no warranties or representations about the accuracy or completeness of the services' content or the content of any websites or mobile applications linked to the services and we will assume no liability or responsibility for any (1) errors, mistakes, or inaccuracies of content and materials, (2) personal injury or property damage, of any nature whatsoever, resulting from your access to and use of the services, (3) any unauthorized access to or use of our secure servers and/or any and all personal information and/or financial information stored therein, (4) any interruption or cessation of transmission to or from the services, (5) any bugs, viruses, trojan horses, or the like which may be transmitted to or through the services by any third party, and/or (6) any errors or omissions in any content and materials or for any loss or damage of any kind incurred as a result of the use of any content posted, transmitted, or otherwise made available via the services. We do not warrant, endorse, guarantee, or assume responsibility for any product or service advertised or offered by a third party through the services, any hyperlinked website, or any website or mobile application featured in any manner or other advertising, and we will not be a party to or in any way be responsible for monitoring any transaction between you and any third-party providers of products or services. As with the purchase of a product or service through any medium or in any environment, you should use your best judgment and exercise caution where appropriate.
